result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel C Sweeney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Added to payment plan in 16CM149.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
May apply for expungment on this case at age 21 if he pays the fines in 16CM149, 16CM160 and 16TR3578 in full as ordered, and has no further criminal charges or convictions.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Samuel C Sweeney
Current: 1017 Harrison Street, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 10-17-2017)
Prior: W11499 Sand Road, Merrillan, WI 54754
Payment Plan Request to combine all cases into one payment plan.  Granted $100.00/month beginning 3-1-17.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Wright.  Plead no contest to amended count 1 in 16CM149.  Obstructing.  Jackson County Ordinance. 9.21.   $100.00 plus costs.  Plead guilty to Count 1 in 16CM160.  Dismiss, but read in count 2 in 16CM160.  Plead no contest to 16TR3578.  OWI 1st, with a PAC <.149.  $937.50.  6 month driver's license revocation.  (No IID requirement).  All other TR's dismissed outright.   Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense and defendant stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Possession of drug paraphernalia in 16CM160, contrary to 961.573(1).  OWI 1st, and Jackson County Ordinance 921 in 16CM149.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Wright.  Defense has all discovery.  Have an agreement.  Set for plea/sentencing.

Pre-trial conference on October 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Wright.   Waive reading of the complaint. Defendant entered NGP.    NGP entered by the court.  PTC set for 10/19 and STC 11/7 at 3 pm.  Bond continued.

Covers 16CM149 and 16CM160.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Recorded by FTR.  Defendant appeared with Attorney Brian Wright.  Attorney Wright has not been appointed on this case yet.  AIA set for 9/26 at 9 am.  Bond continued.
